intro: Agastache pallidiflora subsp. pallidiflora, commonly known as the paleflower hyssop, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of pale lavender to white flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for pollinators and a popular choice in native gardens.
